definition: Silla, Korean kingdom 57 BC-935 AD/one of the Korean Three Kingdoms from 1st century AD, defeating its rivals Paikche 百濟|百济[Bai3 ji4] and Koguryo 高句麗|高句丽[Gao1 gou1 li2] around 660 in alliance with Tang China/unified Silla 658-935
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
new/newly/meso- (chemistry)
gauze/to collect/to gather/to catch/to sift
surname Luo
Xinluo district of Longyan city 龍岩市|龙岩市, Fujian

Silla, Korean kingdom 57 BC-935 AD/one of the Korean Three Kingdoms from 1st century AD, defeating its rivals Paikche 百濟|百济[Bai3 ji4] and Koguryo 高句麗|高句丽[Gao1 gou1 li2] around 660 in alliance with Tang China/unified Silla 658-935
unified Silla (658-935), Korean kingdom

sentences.english: The late Silla split Wang was finally unified, the establishment of the Korean dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 新罗后期分裂，最后被王建统一，建立了高丽王朝。

sentences.english: Choe Chi-won is a well-known Silla poet who writes poetry in Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 崔致远是朝鲜统一新罗时期最著名的汉诗人。

sentences.english: Like Silla, Parhae was a tributary state of Tang-dynasty China.
sentences.chinese: 如新罗一样，渤海国是中国唐朝的属国。

sentences.english: Chapter four mainly expounds Li Jinxing's experience in the war between Tang and Silla.
sentences.chinese: 第四章主要阐述李谨行在唐朝与新罗战争中的史事。

definition: Paekche or Baekje (18 BC-660 AD), one of the Korean Three Kingdoms
Korean Goryeo dynasty, 918-1392/Korea, esp. in context of art and culture

Korean Goryeo Dynasty, 918-1392
the Tang dynasty (618-907)
variant of 高句麗|高句丽[Gao1 gou1 li2]
Nanzhao kingdom 738-937 in southwest China and southeast Asia

Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 遼河|辽河[Liao2 He2]
Tuyuhun, a Xianbei 鮮卑|鲜卑 nomadic people/a state in Qinhai in 4th-7th century AD
Southern Dynasties (420-589)
Western Xia dynasty 1038-1227 of Tangut people 黨項|党项 occupying modern Ningxia and parts of Gansu and Shaanxi, overthrown by Mongols
Joseon, last Korean dynasty (1392-1910)
Huihu, Tang dynasty name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]
